newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's new label standards to take effect March.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's new label standards to take effect March.

text.p: Products sold in Mexico must conform with revised labeling standards beginning March, the Trade and Industry Ministry (Secofi) said on Thursday.
Labels will have to be written in Spanish and include details of contents, country of origin, risks and instructions, if necessary.
Secofi said the new requirements were included in standards 050 and 051, originally published in the Mexican Government's Official Gazette in June 1994.

"Standard 050 is for products in general and will come into effect in two stages, for products imported into the country as of March 1, as well as industrial pproducts," said Raul Ramos, Deputy Minister for Standardization at Secofi.
Standard 050 takes effect on July 1 for "trade in general" Ramos added.
Standard 051, which governs food, will come into force "on July 1 for producers and imported products, and on November 1 for general trade," Ramos said.
The new standards will not apply for some products already covered by official norms such as bulk produce, live animals, books and periodicals.
